caseStudies.title: Security Exchange Platform
caseStudies.intro: A platform for asset owners to track compliance with industry standards in real time and share security requirements with partners transparently.
caseStudies.theproblem: The client brought only a conceptual idea. No features, no flows, and a domain full of heavy cybersecurity and compliance jargon.
caseStudies.thechallenge: Translate a vague vision into a usable, multi-user platform; design for a field the team had no prior knowledge of; ensure clarity for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
caseStudies.constraints: No formal user research budget; multiple user types with overlapping workflows
caseStudies.solutionsandimpact: Multi-user role-based dashboard that prioritized critical compliance alerts; submission system with status tracking to reduce ambiguity; unified design system ensuring visual consistency across future modules; delivered full, dev ready prototype used for investor pitches and stakeholder onboarding.
caseStudies.process: 1 - Rapid onboarding; 2 - Information arquitecture; 3 - Wireframing and prototyping; 4 - ui desing and desing system

caseStudies.title: Gogrow AI
caseStudies.intro: An AI-powered business consulting app that helps companies craft strategies for continuous growth.
caseStudies.theproblem: Stepped into an in-progress product targeting small business owners unfamiliar with advanced digital tools. The existing design suffered from inconsistent brand identity, overwhelming layouts for a non-technical audience, low discoverability of key features
caseStudies.constraints: No formal research budget; limited historical design documentation from previous team that worked on the project
caseStudies.solutionsandimpact: Consolidated navigation into a more predictable structure; consolidated pre-existing brand identity with product's visual identity; exceptionally positive early user feedback, and client satisfaction; client adopted updated brand identity across marketing materials.
caseStudies.process: 1 - PRoduct audit; 2 - addressed urgent usability gaps; 3 - branding consolidation; 4 - post-launch collaborative walkthroughs

caseStudies.title: Degiro Redesign
caseStudies.theproblem: DEGIRO’s app suffered from overloaded information hierarchy, inefficient navigation, poor thumb reachability for key actions, and a lack of high demand usability features
caseStudies.solutions: Larger unobstructed stock charts with relocated value labels, clearer menu with visible settings tab, better information architecture based on user research, reorganized stock details with relevant metrics first, and recommendation wheel replacing hard-to-read financial graphs.
